name: nameofmodel
describe: Since {startDate}, the {departmentName} department has had {leavers} leave.
The {departmentName} department has had {leavers} leave since {startDate}.

explain: Compared to the rest of {companyName}, this is a significant number of leavers and {departmentName} has had peaks of muiltple people leaving around the same time.
This is substantially higher than other departments at {companyName} and most of those departures happened at around the same time.
advise: This would indicate that a specific change, project or person could have triggered this to happen. Try to look at the months before the peak and reflect on what could have triggered this.

That pattern could represent that a specific change, project or person might have been a factor in these departures. If you look back over the months before you might be able to determine what caused this spike.

values: This represents an additional boolean component to this explaination.

explain: Compared to the rest of {companyName}, this is a significant number of leavers and the pattern indicates a disatisfaction.
This is substantially higher than other departments at {companyName} and could indicate that the employees of {department} are not as satisified as they could be.
advise: Ensure that this department is allowed to give their feedback to any changes that are made to projects, people or conditions.
There is improvement to be made here so ensure that this department feels like their feedback is valued and considered.

explain: Compared to the rest of {companyName}, this is a significant number of leavers but the departures have occured consistantly across the year. This normally means there is no one reason for the high number of leavers.

While this is substantially higher than other departments at {companyName}, the departures have occured consistantly across the year. This patterns usually means there is no single reason for the high number of leavers.
advise: Try to understand what makes this role have such a high turnover. It won't be easy to find one answer but listening and fielding feedback from the employees in {departmentName} is a good place to start.

describe: {departmentName} has had no people leave since {startDate}!
Since {startDate}, the {departmentName} department has had {leavers} leave!
The {departmentName} department has had {leavers} leave since {startDate}!
explain: With 0 leavers, turnover is clearly not an impacting factor in {departmentName}.
advise: Having no one leave is great for {departmentName} but make sure that you don't settle for that. Striving to listen to those in the department and acting on their best interest is the best way to ensure a happy and productive team.
